0.title: Adult Dosing
0.mono: Systemic lupus erythematosus, Active, autoantibody-positive, receiving standard therapy: 10 mg/kg IV over 1 hour every 2 weeks for the first 3 doses and every 4 weeks thereafter; consider premedication for potential infusion and hypersensitivity reactions

1.title: Pediatric Dosing
1.mono: safety and effectiveness not established in pediatric patients

3.title: Indications
3.mono:
FDA-Labeled Indications
Systemic lupus erythematosus, Active, autoantibody-positive, receiving standard therapy

sub.title: Contraindications
sub.mono: anaphylaxis reaction to a previous dose of belimumab

sub.title: Precautions
sub.mono:
• lupus, severe active nephritis or central nervous system; use is not recommended
  • concomitant use of IV cyclophosphamide or other biologic therapies, including B-cell targeted therapies; use not recommended
  • depression, including suicidal ideation and behavior or worsening of depression, have been reported
  • hypersensitivity reactions, including anaphylaxis and death, have been reported; onset may be delayed; premedication may mask reaction; monitoring recommended; if severe, discontinue therapy immediately and manage medically
  • infection, chronic; increased risk for developing a serious infection; use not recommended
  • infections, including serious and fatal cases, have been reported; monitoring recommended; interruption of therapy may be necessary
  • infusion reactions have been reported; premedication may mask hypersensitivity or infusion reaction; monitoring recommended; slowing or interruption of infusion may be necessary
  • progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy (PML) JC virus-associated, including fatalities, has been reported; increased risk with immunosuppressant therapy or impaired immune function; consider PML diagnosis for new onset or worsening neurological manifestations; consider neurologist consultation and discontinue treatment if PML occurs
  • live vaccine administration; use not recommended within 30 days of belimumab therapy
  • malignancies have been reported
  • multiple drug allergies or significant hypersensitivities; increased risk of hypersensitivity reaction
  • report suspected adverse reactions to the US Food and Drug Administration at 1-800-FDA-1088 or www.fda.gov/medwatch

sub.title: Breast Feeding
sub.mono: Micromedex: Infant risk cannot be ruled out.

5.title: Adverse Effects
5.mono:
Common
  • Gastrointestinal:Diarrhea (12%), Nausea (15%)
  • Immunologic:Infectious disease (71%), Infusion reaction (17%)
  • Respiratory:Nasopharyngitis (9%)
  • Other:Fever (10%)
Serious
  • Immunologic:Anaphylaxis (0.6%), Hypersensitivity reaction (13%), Infectious disease, Serious (6%), Infusion reaction, Serious (0.5%)
  • Neurologic:Progressive multifocal leukoencephalopathy
  • Psychiatric:Depression (5% to 6.3%), Mental disorder (16%)
  • Respiratory:Bronchitis (9%)
  • Other:Cancer (0.2% to 0.4%)

7.title: Mechanism Of Action
7.mono: Belimumab is human IgG1 lambda monoclonal antibody that inhibits the binding of soluble human B lymphocyte stimulator protein (BLyS) to its receptors on the B cells. Belimumab inhibits the survival of B cells, including autoreactive B cells, and reduces the differentiation of B cells into immunoglobulin-producing plasma cells by inhibiting the binding of BLyS to B cells.

9.title: Administration
9.mono:
Intravenous
  • allow the lyophilized powder vial to stand at room temperature for 10 to 15 minutes
  • reconstitute with sterile water for injection; swirl the vial gently for 60 seconds every 5 minutes until the powder is dissolved; reconstitution may take up to 30 minutes
  • dilute the reconstituted belimumab solution to 250 mL in NS
  • complete the infusion within 8 hours of the start of reconstitution
  • infuse the diluted solution IV over 1 hour; do not give IV push or IV bolus

10.title: Monitoring
10.mono:
• improvements in objective measures of disease activity indicate a therapeutic response
  • signs and symptoms of hypersensitivity reactions; during and for several hours after first 2 infusions; during and for appropriate time after subsequent infusions

13.title: Clinical Teaching
13.mono:
• Advise patient to avoid live vaccines for at least 30 days prior and during therapy, due to potential interference with immunization response.
  • Instruct female patient to avoid pregnancy during therapy and for at least 4 months after the last dose.
  • Side effects may include nausea, diarrhea, fever, insomnia, migraine, or bronchitis.
  • Tell patient to report new or worsening neurologic symptoms (ie, memory loss, confusion, dizziness, loss of balance, difficulty walking or talking, or vision changes).
  • Advise patient to report symptoms of infection or delayed-onset hypersensitivity reactions.
  • Instruct patient to report new or worsening depression, suicidal ideation, or mood changes.
